column2: Apache has quarterly loss on lower oil pricesBRIEF-Apache eyes more Eagle Ford activity at $65 a barrel-CEO * CEO says on track to achieve 25 percent reduction in average drilling and completion costs  BRIEF-Apache eyes more Eagle Ford activity at $65 a barrel-CEO * CEO says on track to achieve 25 percent reduction in average drilling and completion costs May 7 Apache Corp on Thursday reported a quarterly loss compared with a year-earlier profit as significantly lower commodity prices prompted the U.S. oil and gas company to write down the value of some oil and gas properties.BRIEF-Apache eyes more Eagle Ford activity at $65 a barrel-CEO * CEO says on track to achieve 25 percent reduction in average drilling and completion costs
UPDATE 1-Bank of America directors lose support from shareholders NEW YORK
column3: May 7 Four Bank of America Corp  directors on the board's governance committee received unusually small majorities of votes for re-election at this week's annual meeting
column4: according to tallies the company released on Thursday.

column2: EU patent office revokes Celgene Revlimid patent; appeal plannedUPDATE 1-EU patent office revokes Celgene Revlimid patent; appeal planned May 7 Celgene Corp on Thursday said the European Patent Office revoked a key patent on the company's flagship multiple myeloma drug Revlimid

column2: Metro bids for EQT's Classic Fine Foods -sources FRANKFURT
column3: May 7 German retail group Metro  has made a tentative bid for private equity-owned
column4: Singapore-based Classic Fine Foods in a deal potentially worth $300-$400 million including debt
column5: three sources familiar with the deal said.

column2: CORRECTED-J&J; to consult ethicists on requests for experimental drugs NEW YORK
column3: May 7 Johnson & Johnson will become the first pharmaceutical company to formally seek advice from outside medical ethicists on "compassionate use" requests
column4: in which desperate patients ask drugmakers to let them take an experimental medication
column5: the company announced on Thursday.

column2: Lockheed F-35 gets first female pilot - Air Force WASHINGTON
column3: May 6 Lieutenant Colonel Christine Mau
column4: a U.S. Air Force pilot who    was part of the first all-female combat sortie over Afghanistan in 2011
column5: this week became the first woman to fly the Lockheed Martin Corp  F-35 jet
column6: the Air Force said on Wednesday.

column2: MasterCard doubles card numbers in Middle East
column3: Africa DUBAI MasterCard Inc  has doubled the number of its cards to about 100 million in the Middle East and Africa in the past three years
column4: where it has begun setting up partnerships with governments to provide access to its payments system.

column2: UPDATE 1-Molson Coors sales miss estimates on lower demand
column3: strong dollar May 7 Molson Coors Brewing Co reported lower-than-expected quarterly net sales
column4: hurt by lower demand for its beer and a strong dollar.
